review_blob: Tried both on draught and in can.  Both very good.  The draught was very fresh and floral.  Lots of sticky hops.  big beer.
great beer, dark color, rich flavor, great mix of roasted malt and bitterness.
12oz btl- Interesting to say the least.  It really is like pumpkin pie in a bottle.  Great spices of clove and cinnemon. Not my favorite style of beer, but I had no problem drinking the glass.
Not much to this beer at all.  Stinky nose and light color.  Very light in body.  This beer comes off as a little too sour.  Very simple American style beer.  Not very good

Very unique to say the least.  not much on the nose, or the head.  It is a bit sweeter than I was hoping for, and the sour finish lasts a long time.  A bit too sour for the level of sweetness.  I was hoping the hops would have made it more dry and bitter.  Not bad overall, but one glass is enough.  I will say that I would have never guessed that this beer is 20% abv.  The alcohol is masked to say the least.
This beer is just bad.  Usually something marketed as an ale should have some hops, but this is sweet and carmely.  Not recommended
not a fan of this at all.  too sweet and there is a nasty fake fruit flavor that I think is supposed to be lemon, but is more like Fruit Loops
I did not like this beer at all. Huge head, but disappeared in a matter of seconds. No character at all.
No hops, no malt, too sweet for me. Not a big fan of this beer. Reminds me of Rolling Rock
I have enjoyed this beer over the last few years and it has not disapointed me this year.Good summer beer.

beer_brewer_name: Old Dominion Brewing Company (Coastal Brewing Co.)
review_blob: Very Good.  This is like the Dominion lager on steroids.  Highly recommended.
lightly hoped with a great balance of malt.  A perfectly acceptable helles.  Overall I enjoyed it.

I went into this beer expecting much more.  It was a little too sweet and syrupy for me.  Kind of soda like.  Medium body and light to medium hops.  My disapointment might also come from the fact that I drank a Victory Storm King moments before.
I will call it refreshing, but that is about it.  I like it more than most commercial domestics.
Good beer, no head, but nice nose.  A little sweeter and thicker than I would have liked, but still good stout.
Very well made beer.  The hype caused for a bit of a let down.  I do love this beer, but I do not know if it the greatest beer in the world.  I think I like v-10 as much

HUGE!  The very dark color is not deceiving at all.  Very full bodied with notes of chocolate and coffee on the nose, and big roasted malt on the palate.  Awsome beer.  It looks like a cappicino in the glass.

The car was a quart low, but now I have something to fix it with.  What a great appearance this beer has.  I love a beer that looks like motor oil.  What a great beer.  very full bodied with a great roasted malt flavor.  nice undertones of chocolate and citrusy hops.  Bravo Victory
Year in and year out I have loved this beer, and the 2002 edition has not let me down.  I love most of all the intensity of the fruit driven hops on the palate. Rock on Celebration Ale
This is a well made beer.  A wonderful roasted malt taste comes out in this brew.  A nice winter beer.

beer_brewer_name: Wild Goose Brewery (Frederick Brewing Company/Flying Dog)
review_blob: I enjoyed this beer very much.  Very well balanced and easy to drink.  a good example of a brown ale.

What a great beer.  This is the perfect after dinner beer.  So full in body and flavor.  There are wonderful chocolate and roasted malt flavors in this beer that almost make me think of a port wine.  AWSOME!

Nice color, but very light in body.  Could be an OK tasting beer except for the fact that the clear bottle has skunked the hops beyond beleif.  Not very good out of the bottle.  It is a much better beer on draught, but still a little light and watery for my palate.
Dont let the dark color fool you.  This beer is much lighter than I though it was going to be.  There is a little sweetness that does not belong.  Not a very good beer, and oh, cooked beyond beleif.

beer_brewer_name: Old Dominion Brewing Company (Coastal Brewing Co.)
review_blob: This is a very well made pale ale.  great hops on the nose and palate.  And a nice balance of malt as well.
A very well made beer.  This is a perfect everyday beer.  Malt driven and well balanced.
What a great Pils.  The nose is a blast of canabus, and the palate is a wonderfully balanced explosion of hops.  Great beer!
A nice lager with a bit more hop than I was expecting.  Nice malty flavors, but a touch to candied.

Not nearly as lame as I thought the beer was going to be.  Well, at least it was better than the bottle.  Still, a very plain beer with a little more sweetness than I would like out of a beer with this light flavor and body.  Not recomended, but in a jam it would be OK to drink.

Very light in body and flavor.  Not a very good beer.  There is a terrible metalic finish on the beer.  Not at all recommended.  It is also noticably skunked, but that is from the green bottle I would imagine.

From a bottle.  This beer is not very good at all.  The nose and the palate give off a very oxidized carachteristic, and in general the beer is completely lackluster.  It reminds me of Yeungling Lager.

beer_brewer_name: Old Dominion Brewing Company (Coastal Brewing Co.)
review_blob: I have always enjoyed this beer.  It has a wonderful balance of malt and hop.  It is the perfect beer to convince friends to try a craft brew.
An excellant wheat beer.  There is a beautiful balance of banana and spice.  A great mouthfill.  A very nice beer for the summer.

beer_brewer_name: Magic Hat Brewing Company (North American Breweries)
review_blob: Not a very exciting beer.  If it is supposed to be a wheat beer, it is not very true to style.  Being that it is filtered takes alot away from the beer.  There is a bit of bitterness on the palate and not much on the nose.  Not a very well structured beer.
Great brew.  Tones of citrus and spice jump out at you in this beer.  Very refreshing, perfect summer beer.

beer_brewer_name: Wild Goose Brewery (Frederick Brewing Company/Flying Dog)
review_blob: While it is a good quality beer, there is entirely too much smoke.  The hops are completly overpowered by the smoky malt.  A little too over the top.  While Blue Ridge has been doing well, this beer is unfortunatly an exception for me.

beer_brewer_name: Wild Goose Brewery (Frederick Brewing Company/Flying Dog)
review_blob: I really enjoyed this beer when I tried it this time around.  The bottle I had was very fresh.  The beer had nice fruit driven hops and good malt.  I have had the beer in the past and it was only OK.  But Blue Ridge is really making some great strides in the recent past.  I hope they keep up the good work.
A good example of a pale ale.  Very nice balance so that the malt stands up a bit to the hops.  A good beer
Sweet malt drives this brew.  A great tasting beer. could use a little more hop to balance it out though.
A good Porter with pleasant roasted malt flavors on the palate and the nose.  I bit of sweetnes is what finishes this beer.
What a great belgian style triple. The beer, which has a beautiful gold color has strong notes of spice and candy sugar.  GM hides the 9.5% very well.  almost dangerously well.
Wow, One of the best Pils I have ever tasted.  A beautiful balance of superior hops and malt.  Very crisp and refreshing. Great Job.

beer_brewer_name: Old Dominion Brewing Company (Coastal Brewing Co.)
review_blob: very good, cloves and oranges come out in this very refreshing summer beer
One of the best IPAs I have ever tasted.  The hops explode in both the nose and the palate. This is a big, full flavored beer with a ton of body to back up the hops.
